oai_dc:dc.dc:title: VERIFICATION OF A ONE-DIMENSIONAL SURFBEAT MODEL AGAINST LABORATORY DATA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roelvink, J.A.
Petit, H.A.H.
Kostense, J.K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surf beat
laboratory data
model verification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A mathematical model is presented which describes cross-shore low-frequency motions generated by shoaling and breaking of wave-groups on a beach. The numerical scheme is tested against known analytical solutions for standing waves on a plane beach. Model results are compared with laboratory experiments (Kostense, 1984) which refer to bichromatic carrier waves incident on a plane beach. It is shown that, apart from a good representation of the trends found in the experimental study, for realistic values of the breaking and friction coefficients the computational results also quantitatively agree surprisingly well with the experiments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
